# Custom Online Data Extraction

There are a lot of important areas for **Graphical Modelling and Causal Inference** on tabular data. Find a selection of **categories** and **useful websites** for custom data extraction below. Please consider submitting the final extracted and analyzed dataset (if allowed) to our [Zenodo community](https://zenodo.org/communities/mardigmci/records?q=&l=list&p=1&s=10).

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## **Economic & Financial Data**

**Possible causal relationships:**

-   inflation affects employment

-   policies impact market behavior

| Source | License | Data Provided |
|-----------------|----------------------------------------|---------------|
| **World Bank Open Data** | CC BY 4.0 ([License](https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/public-licenses)) | Time Series Data, Performance Indicators |
| **OECD Data** | CC BY 4.0 ([License](https://www.oecd.org/en/about/terms-conditions.html)) | Consumer Price Indices, Institutional Investors' Indicators |
| **Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED)** | Non-commercial ([License](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/legal/)) | Economic data series on banking, business, consumer and producer price indices, employment, population, exchange rates, GDP, interest rates, trade, and U.S. financial data. |

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## **Social & Behavioral Data**

**Possible causal relationships:**

-   Work conditions influence family stability

-   Political climate affects public trust in media

-   Immigration policies shape public attitudes

| Source | License | Data Provided |
|-----------------|------------------------------------|-------------------|
| General Social Survey (GSS) | Purchase required (<https://gss.norc.org/content/dam/gss/get-documentation/pdf/other/ObtainingGSSSensitiveDataFiles.pdf)> | Health, marriage, family, work conditions |
| Pew Research Data | Nonexclusive, non-sublicensable, non-transferable, revocable, worldwide, royalty-free (<https://www.pewresearch.org/about/terms-and-conditions/)> | Politics, immigration, religion, technology |
| European Social Survey (ESS) | Open access | Politics, international affairs, immigration, religion |

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## **Environmental & Ecological Data**

Climate change, pollution, and biodiversity studies require causal modeling for impact assessment.

**Possible datasets:**

-   Climate change and greenhouse gas emissions

-   Biodiversity and species distribution

-   Air and water quality

**Example sources:**

-   [NASA Earth Data](https://earthdata.nasa.gov/)

-   [Copernicus Climate Data](https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu/)

-   [Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF)](https://www.gbif.org/)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## **Engineering & Sensor Data**

Sensor-based datasets (IoT, industrial processes, robotics) can provide time-series data for causal discovery.

**Possible datasets:**

-   Smart cities and traffic monitoring

-   Industrial machine failure predictions

-   Energy consumption and grid stability

**Example sources:**

-   [OpenML](https://www.openml.org/)

-   [UCI Machine Learning Repository](https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/index.php)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## **Political & Legal Data**

Causal models can analyze policy effects, election predictions, and legal case outcomes.

**Possible datasets:**

-   Election results and voter behavior

-   Government spending and policy impact

-   Legal case rulings and sentencing patterns

**Example sources:**

-   [Congressional Voting Records](https://www.govtrack.us/)

-   [Comparative Political Data Set (CPDS)](https://www.cpds-data.org/)

-   [World Justice Project Rule of Law Index](https://worldjusticeproject.org/)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## **Transportation & Mobility Data**

Causal analysis in urban planning, traffic patterns, and logistics is crucial for optimizing transport systems.

**Possible datasets:**

-   Public transportation ridership data

-   Road traffic and accident reports

-   Flight delays and logistics performance

**Example sources:**

-   [U.S. Department of Transportation Open Data](https://data.transportation.gov/)

-   [NYC Open Data (Taxi & Traffic Data)](https://data.cityofnewyork.us/Transportation/Taxi/mch6-rqy4)

-   [OpenStreetMap Traffic Data](https://www.openstreetmap.org/)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## **Education Data**

Educational outcomes are often influenced by multiple factors (socioeconomic status, school policies, etc.), making them ideal for causal modeling.

**Possible datasets:**

-   Student performance and test scores

-   School funding and academic achievement

-   Higher education statistics

**Example sources:**

-   [National Center for Education Statistics (NCES)](https://nces.ed.gov/)

-   [OECD Education at a Glance](https://www.oecd.org/en/publications/education-at-a-glance-2024_c00cad36-en.html)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## **Crime & Justice Data**

Understanding the causal effects of policies, policing, and social factors on crime rates is crucial.

**Possible datasets:**

-   Crime rates and law enforcement reports

-   Prison population statistics

-   Impact of social programs on crime reduction

**Example sources:**

-   [FBI Crime Data Explorer](https://cde.ucr.cjis.gov/)

-   [Bureau of Justice Statistics (BJS)](https://bjs.ojp.gov/)

-   [UK Crime Data](https://data.police.uk/)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## **Energy & Sustainability Data**

Causal relationships between energy consumption, economic growth, and environmental policies are important.

**Possible datasets:**

-   Renewable energy production

-   Electricity grid performance

-   Carbon footprint analysis

**Example sources:**

-   [International Energy Agency (IEA)](https://www.iea.org/data-and-statistics)

-   [Our World in Data â€“ Energy](https://ourworldindata.org/energy)

-   [U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA)](https://www.eia.gov/)
